;

;The Double Eleven shopping carnival is coming. In the past few days, the "low-price agreement" controversy in the live broadcast room has arisen again and again. From the lead anchor Li Jiaqi being accused of "choosing one of the two", to Brother Yang angrily criticizing Li Jiaqi for "price monopoly", and then Brother Dayang's company was revealed to have a price guarantee agreement.

;

;For a time, the "minimum price agreement" hidden behind the leading anchors was put on the table, and a storm of public opinion about price and law began. An industry insider told reporters from Nandu and N Video, "In the past few years, anchors would clarify the content of the 'minimum price agreement', but now they may find ways to avoid this expression, such as 'This price must be the maximum discount given by the brand.'" ."

;

;In this regard, on October 30, Hangzhou issued the "Livestreaming E-commerce Industry Compliance Guidelines (Draft for Comments)" which clarified that livestreaming e-commerce practitioners must not require merchants to sign a "minimum price agreement." . Zheng Ning, director of the Law Department of the School of Cultural Industry Management of Communication University of China, told Nandu reporters that this is a "Guideline" issued at the local level and has no mandatory legal effect. It may not be applicable to other regions, but it can serve as a leading example for the whole country.

;

;;Reduced Price Controversy;

;

;At the end of October, a salesperson posted on WeChat Moments that Li Jiaqi was suspected of "choosing one of the two." It stated that it received a lawyer's letter from the brand owner Hai's. The brand complained that because the price of a certain Hai's oven on the platform was lower than the price of Li Jiaqi's live broadcast, it violated the "reservoir price agreement" signed between them and Li Jiaqi and required huge liquidated damages.

;

;Subsequently, Hai's issued a statement stating that it had not signed any "reserve price agreement" with the channel mentioned by the sales staff.

;

;When Nandu reporters asked the relevant person in charge of Li Jiaqi’s operator Meizhi (Shanghai) Network Technology Co., Ltd. (hereinafter referred to as "Meizhi Company"), the other party did not respond.

;

;The company’s official website competition and compliance announcement states that “Meijia strictly adheres to the principles of equality, voluntariness, fairness, honesty and credit, and fully respects the independent business rights of merchants.”

;

;And that’s it. Not long ago, a "post-90s" investment specialist of Meizhi Company took advantage of his position to provide merchants with help in product selection and live broadcast scheduling, and collected over one million yuan in benefits. He was found guilty of bribery by non-state personnel and position-related crimes. Crime of embezzlement.

;

;On the evening of November 4, Meishi Company issued a statement stating that the labor contract had been terminated and that there was no green channel for the investment promotion and product selection process.

;

;Nandu reporters noticed that on the same day that the sales staff shouted to Li Jiaqi, e-commerce anchor Dayang Ge angrily criticized Li Jiaqi for price control in the "Crazy Little Yang Ge" live broadcast room, "How much lower are we than Li Jiaqi?" , then nothing can be sold, he can build a platform by himself."

;

;;

;

;Brother Yang said Li Jiaqi controls prices.

;

;What is intriguing is that not long after Brother Yang angrily criticized Li Jiaqi, it was revealed that the live broadcast room of "Crazy Little Brother Yang" had an insured contract, and "the amount of compensation stipulated in the event of breach of contract is 1 million yuan."

;

;The "Supply Chain" column of the official website of Hefei Sanguangyang Network Technology Co., Ltd., the company to which "Crazy Little Yang" belongs, points out the requirement for "price control", that is, "the whole network has the same price" We control the price of each product to ensure that the live broadcast room is truly cost-effective.”

;

;One wave has not subsided, but another wave has arisen.

;

;On November 2, netizens discovered that Simba’s Douyin account had been banned. According to people familiar with the matter, "Simba has repeatedly published false information on Douyin, insulted and abused, and provoked wars."

;

;Nandu reporters noticed that in a previous live broadcast on Douyin, Simba once said "I don't care about your platform, nor your traffic."

;

;;

;

;Simba’s Douyin account has been banned.

;

;It is reported that Simba sold a Mousse mattress originally priced at more than 20,000 yuan for 4,980 yuan in a previous live broadcast, bringing more than 1 billion in goods to Mousse live broadcast. This caused dissatisfaction among many offline dealers of Mousse.

;

;The day before his account was banned, Simba angrily shouted in the Douyin live broadcast room, "Can you please stop messing with me? I, Xin Youzhi, don't have the ability to monopolize an industry." "No matter how much I sell, It doesn’t matter to you, my customers are not your users, and Mousse mattresses are not allowed to be taken off the shelves before the 31st.”

;

;For a time, a storm of public opinion surrounding the live broadcast e-commerce industry was unfolding.

;

;;Monopoly suspicion;

;

;“The floor price agreement definitely exists.” On November 4, Mr. Li, a brand manager in the cosmetics industry, told Nandu reporters "In the past few years, it would have been written very clearly. Now anchors may find ways to avoid this expression. For example, 'this price must be the maximum discount given by the brand', which means the same thing as 'minimum price agreement', but The way of expression is different."

;

;"If the brand violates the 'minimum price agreement', the anchor may not necessarily file a lawsuit with the brand, but he may not help the brand bring goods, or may not do so in the future. Cooperation." Mr. Li believes that this kind of loss is unbearable for the brand.

;

;It is reported that the day after the sales staff shouted out Li Jiaqi, the person in charge of home appliances and furniture of an e-commerce platform posted in Moments, "Some top anchors deprive consumers of their enjoyment for their own selfish interests. It’s really a chaos of low-price rights, and we must resist the overbearing clauses of ‘low-price agreements’ across the entire network.”

;

;Does the “low-price agreement” signed between the anchor and the brand involve a violation of the “Anti-Monopoly Law” Behavior? Ding Maozhong, director of the Competition Law Research Center of Shanghai University of Political Science and Law, told Nandu reporters that this requires standardized analysis. Judging from the identification standards of the Anti-Monopoly Law, a clear conclusion cannot yet be given.

;

; "Monopoly agreements are divided into horizontal monopoly agreements and vertical monopoly agreements. The prerequisite for a horizontal monopoly agreement is that there is a competitive relationship between operators, and there is no competitive relationship between the anchor and the brand." Ding Maozhong explained.

;

;He said that the vertical monopoly agreement mainly depends on whether it has a dominant market position and whether there is abuse of market dominance. "This requires a series of normative analyses. For example, the prerequisite for abusing a dominant market position is that the operator must have a dominant market position. Judging from the current situation, it cannot be concluded whether the anchor violates the Anti-Monopoly Law."< /p>;

;So, what is "choose one" behavior? Ding Maozhong explained that this is an abuse of market dominance to restrict transactions. "First of all, the operator must have a dominant market position. Secondly, the operator, without legitimate reasons, restricts the transaction counterparty to only trade with it or only with its designated operator, which constitutes the so-called 'choose one of the two'. "

;

;As for whether Li Jiaqi is involved in "choosing one of the two," Ding Maozhong said that this also requires a standardized analysis based on specific factors.

;

;;Development Prospects;

;

;Whether it is a "lower price agreement" or a "choose one", it is actually a battle between anchors about the "lowest price" scramble.

;

;;;

;The head anchor Li Jiaqi.

;

;Mr. Li, the brand manager of the cosmetics industry, believes that excessive pursuit of “minimizing” prices is not a good thing for brands.

;

; "The anchor keeps the brand's price to the lowest, and the brand may think about how to reduce production costs simultaneously, and the quality will also decrease relatively. And this is a fatal blow to the innovation of the company." He said, Enterprises no longer aim at product upgrades, but are forced to find cheaper production methods, which is actually a step back for the development of enterprises.

;

;On the surface, the anchor is seeking benefits for consumers by requiring merchants to sign a "lower price agreement." In fact, the "lowest price on the entire network" serves as a trump card for anchors to attract consumers and promotes the popularity of live broadcast rooms. It not only increases the influence of anchors, but can even further increase their live broadcast commissions.

;

;The increase in the profits of anchors selling goods also eats up the development space of brands. In the long run, the industry cannot sustain healthy development, low-priced products will eventually disappear, and consumers will have to pay for new high-priced products.

;

;Faced with the “lowest prices” that can be seen everywhere in the live broadcast room, who sets the price of the product?

;

;Ding Maozhong introduced that live broadcast pricing does not deviate from the legal framework. The Price Law divides pricing into two categories: one is market independent pricing, and the other is regulated by the government. Among the products promoted and sold by anchors, products that do not fall within the scope of government guidance or pricing are all market-adjusted prices.

;

;The "Price Law" stipulates that in principle, sales at a loss, price gouging and other behaviors that seriously disrupt the market order cannot be carried out. The "Consumer Rights and Interests Protection Law" also stipulates that consumers' rights to fair transactions must be ensured. Buying and selling must be fair and reasonable, and prices must be clearly marked. Prices must not be increased first and then reduced through promotions.

;

;;Standardize order;

;

;Relevant departments have also issued relevant "Guidelines" regarding the pricing of e-commerce live broadcasts to regulate market development.

;

;On October 30, Hangzhou released the "Livestreaming E-commerce Industry Compliance Guidelines (Draft for Comments)" (hereinafter referred to as the "Guidelines"), soliciting opinions and suggestions from all walks of life.

;

;It is mentioned that live broadcast e-commerce practitioners shall not require merchants to sign a "minimum price agreement" or adopt other agreements, decisions or coordinated actions that exclude or restrict competition, except for those that do not constitute a monopoly agreement according to law.

;

;In addition, regarding the legal content of prices, live broadcast e-commerce practitioners are reminded not to abuse their independent pricing rights through low-price dumping, price collusion, price gouging, price fraud, etc.

;

;"The "Guidelines" released this time have national demonstration significance." Zheng Ning, director of the Law Department of the School of Cultural Industry Management of Communication University of China, told Nandu reporters.

;

;Zheng Ning said, "The "Guidelines" are an integration of existing regulations for live broadcast e-commerce. They provide a certain degree of operability for how live broadcast e-commerce can establish compliance systems before, during and after the event. "Guidance."

;

;"Of course, we must also see that this "Guideline" does not have mandatory legal effect after all." Zheng Ning believes that this is a "Guideline" issued at the local level and may not directly apply to other region, but it can serve as a leading example for the whole country.

;

;The effectiveness of the "Guidelines" remains to be seen.

;

;She suggested that from the regulatory perspective, inspections and law enforcement should be stepped up, and strict enforcement of laws and regulations should be carried out. At the same time, consumers should also be encouraged to actively supervise and report and safeguard their rights legitimately.

;

;Starting from the platform itself, live broadcast e-commerce platforms must strengthen personnel and system construction and improve compliance management levels. From an industry perspective, the most important thing is to give full play to the role of industry self-discipline.

;

;Ding Maozhong told Nandu reporters that in the supervision of the live broadcast e-commerce industry, platforms have the responsibility to manage product promotion. "For typical violations of laws and regulations, the platform can make requirements and some advocacy suggestions."

;Hong Huanhuan taught her sister-in-law to make paper flowers using toilet paper. Photo provided by the interviewee

;

;Until October 25, 2023, Hong Huanhuan’s relatives and friends came to the community and held up placards asking the residents here to provide information about her life over the past year. , the details of the work, residents of Building 14 of Yintai Yuhuayuan in Wuhan, Hubei Province realized that an ambulance had pulled a female domestic worker away from the building in the morning three days ago.

;

;Since September 2022, Hong Huanhuan, as a live-in nanny, has been taking care of the children of her employer Xiong, a pair of twins who have just turned two years old. On the morning of October 22, 2023, the 38-year-old fell to the ground at Xiong’s home. A few hours later, relatives and friends rushed to the hospital after hearing the news and saw her body.

;

;"What impressed me most was my sister's eyes that she never closed until she died, and the tears in the corners of her eyes." On October 31, Hong Huanhuan's brother Hong Mingxuan told Southern Weekend reporter.

;

;The last time Hong Huanhuan saw her family was during the May Day holiday in 2023. She and her husband returned to their hometown in Hanchuan, Hubei Province to visit their children and the elderly at home. Over the next five months, whenever someone wanted to ask her out, she always said she was too busy at her employer's house. In early October, Xiong called the housekeeping company and told the housekeeping company that Dabao accidentally injured his leg when Hong Huanhuan took her child to play on the slide on October 2. The housekeeping company immediately offered to visit her, but Xiong refused.

;

;When we meet again, we will be separated forever. The family found a wound on her head and multiple bruises on her body and immediately called the police. The doctor told Hong Mingxuan that Hong Huanhuan had no heartbeat at Xiong's home.

;

;;
;

;

;

;First time moving into the home

;

;It has been nearly 10 years since Yintai Yuhuayuan was built. Lianjia APP shows that this community’s historical transaction volume and listing price of nearly 25,000 yuan per square meter are the highest in Wuhan’s Baibuting area.

;

;Several neighbors recalled that in 2020 or even earlier, Xiong bought the four-bedroom, two-bedroom apartment in Yintai Yuhuayuan from the previous resident. Wei's house has an area of ​​about 160 square meters. Wang Yifei, a neighbor across the door, told Southern Weekend reporters that he visited Xiong's house when it was being renovated. It was "Chinese style, all made of mahogany, very luxurious. It is said to have been left behind by the previous owner."

;

;Wang Yifei said that he likes to chat with people, but does not like to deal with Xiong, because the other party often talks about issues such as community hygiene, neighbor decoration, and exercise noise downstairs. In the building group, they criticized others and used fierce language. Sometimes when he meets Hong Huanhuan in the elevator, Wang Yifei will chat with her.

;

;On November 8, a Southern Weekend reporter called Xiong’s contact number and it showed that the machine was down. According to the content recorded on Xiong’s short video account, she is born in the 1970s. She previously worked in the female body care business in Zaozhuang, Shandong, Xuzhou, Jiangsu and other places. She returned to Hubei in 2020 and opened a shop on the second floor of Yintai Yuhuayuan in the second half of the year. opened a beauty salon. Currently, the beauty salon is closed.

;

;A merchant surnamed Yuan downstairs of the beauty salon recalled to Southern Weekend reporters that Xiong's hometown is in Huangpi, Wuhan, and he bought the second-floor store from himself in 2020. , the lease term was agreed to be three years. Less than a year later, due to pregnancy, he planned to sell the store, and there was "a little dispute" when he quit the lease.

;

;The husband did not appear in the short video taken by Xiong. After returning to Wuhan, most of the content she posted was related to emotions, and sometimes she revealed her depressed side. At the end of August 2021, the twins, a boy and a girl, were born. From the moment the baby could raise his head, to babbling, to taking the baby for a walk, she liked to share everything online. She said that she wanted to be a happy mother for the sake of her children, but she also said that whether her temper was good or not depended on "how you treat me."

;

;On October 6, after the child was injured while playing on the slide, Xiong asked among his neighbors if there were any hourly workers he knew well, and requested that he cook lunch once a day and clean the house. Home Hygiene. Many neighbors recalled that they had never met Xiong's husband. Before that, Xiong's father occasionally came over to help with the child, but he returned to his home two months before the incident.

;

;;

;

;On October 28, 2023, the door of Xiong’s house was closed, and no one answered the knock on the door. Photo by Southern Weekend reporter Wang Xuqiulin

;

;Hong Huanhuan was an employee of Wuhan Auntie Lai Housekeeping Service Co., Ltd. during his lifetime. Carrying twins for Xiong was Hong Huanhuan's first job since she was transferred to a new job as a nanny, with a monthly salary of 6,500 yuan. In the opinion of a colleague named Hu, the salary of this job is not high. According to the market price in Wuhan, it costs 6,000-8,000 yuan for a nanny to take care of a child who is not in kindergarten. "Generally, two aunts take care of twins."

;

;Before the job transfer, Hong Huanhuan's position was as a domestic agent. Former colleague Gao Xuemei explained to a reporter from Southern Weekend that in a housekeeping company, an agent's income mainly depends on personal performance. "The more orders you sign, the more you get." In the past few years due to the epidemic, some domestic workers have had a heavy financial burden and have chosen to change careers. The wages of domestic agents have also dropped from seven to eight thousand yuan per month to at most four to five thousand yuan.

;

;Hong Huanhuan’s husband Wu Qiang works on the assembly line of an electronics factory in Wuhan, and his father-in-law has a pension. My father-in-law passed away due to illness in 2021. My 70-year-old mother-in-law has underlying diseases and has to take care of their two children who are in school in their hometown in Hanchuan.

;

;"I didn't make much money in the past few years, so my sister said I needed a stable job." Hong Mingxuan explained the reason why Hong Huanhuan became a childcare nanny. His wife is the general manager of Wuhan Auntie Housekeeping Company.

;

;Hong Mingxuan and Hong Huanhuan grew up together. He recalled that after graduating from junior high school, his sister first went to work in Guangdong and then went to Zhangjiakou to set up a stall. In 2018, she returned to Wuhan to work as a housekeeper to be closer to the children and to take care of the elderly. During this period, she took the nanny qualification certificate.

;

;Gao Xuemei recalled that the two met in October 2022 after Hong Huanhuan moved into the household. Hong Huanhuan said that she and Xiong took care of the baby together. She took the baby to bed at night, and the child's grandfather was responsible for doing housework. Hong Huanhuan mentioned that her clients love to keep their homes clean. Although she does not need to do most of the hygiene, she will help with cleaning and washing baby clothes as long as she has time.

;

;Hong Huanhuan told Gao Xuemei at that time, "Bao's mother (Xiong) may not be in a good mood sometimes, and sometimes she will curse" and sometimes lose her temper at her , and when he is good to her, he is very nice.

;

;“I broke my client’s child’s bone after falling”

;

;After the child’s accident on the slide, Xiong’s short video account had more than a dozen There has been no update for days. On October 16, she sang in a new video, "The happiness I envy is always not available, and the people I love who love me are not taken care of."

;

;The above-mentioned merchant recalled that previously, Xiong and Hong Huanhuan often took their two children for walks in and around the community garden. One day in early October, she once saw Xiong with a red face, as if he had drunk alcohol. As he walked, he scolded Hong Huanhuan behind him for being "too cruel." In the next few days, Hong Huanhuan came to her store to pick up the express delivery, and she found that he "was not looking very well."

;

;According to rumors, Xiong asked Hong Huanhuan to compensate Hong Huanhuan 100,000 yuan after his child was injured while playing on the slide. Hong Mingxuan confirmed this amount to Southern Weekend reporters. The second sisters of Hong Mingxuan, Gao Xuemei and Wu Qiang said that after the incident, Hong Huanhuan borrowed money from them or people around her on WeChat.

;

;In October, the winter jujubes in Gao Xuemei's hometown were ripe. She sent Hong Huanhuan a WeChat message: "Huanhuan, give me your home address and send the jujubes to you." At around 11 o'clock in the evening on October 12, Hong Huanhuan replied: "Don't send it, I'm not in the mood to eat it. I broke the customer's child's leg." Gao Xuemei asked, but Hong Huanhuan did not reply.

;

;On October 20, Gao Xuemei received a text message from Hong Huanhuan: "Dear, do you have any money? Can you lend me 10,000 yuan?" She replied: "Huanhuan, I'm sorry, my mother was diagnosed with cancer two months ago. She is undergoing radiotherapy and chemotherapy this month, and may need an operation. I really don't have much money to give you." Hong Huanhuan told her: "It's okay, it's okay. I've pretty much taken care of it here. I caused you trouble." This was their last contact.

;

;Wu Qiang’s second sister said that a few days before the incident, Hong Huanhuan also borrowed money from Wu Qiang’s eldest sister. The eldest sister handed over the money without saying anything. Afterwards, the eldest sister talked to her about the hurried video call and recalled that Hong Huanhuan wore a mask the whole time at Xiong's house.

;

;Wu Qiang’s second sister later calculated that since October, Wu Qiang and his relatives and friends had given Hong Huanhuan a total of 61,000 yuan.

;

;Hong Mingxuan also lent money to his sister. He said he didn't ask much at the time. After all, the child was injured and it was understandable that his sister needed to compensate.

;

;Hong Mingxuan said that before joining the household in 2022, Hong Huanhuan was diagnosed with gallstones and other indicators were normal, but he did not provide the corresponding physical examination report.

;

;They don’t know why Hong Huanhuan died suddenly. Many neighbors interviewed said that they did not pay attention to the family's movements. Only the camera installed by Wang Yifei in the corridor recorded some of the family's comings and goings on October 21 and 22.

;

;At 8:35, 10:26 and 17:32 on the 21st, Xiong, Hong Huanhuan and a middle-aged woman with short hair took two The children came in and out of the house three times. Among them, the short-haired woman was always carrying a girl, Xiong was pushing a car with a boy in it, and Hong Huanhuan was wearing gray short-sleeves and gray trousers. Hong Huanhuan wore a mask when she went out twice. When she appeared in front of the camera, she did not take her children with her. She always carried handbags, vegetables or garbage.

;

;;

;

;In the surveillance video, on October 21, 2023, Xiong (left) and Hong Huanhuan (right) walked out of the elevator mouth. Video screenshot

;

;The camera did not record when the five of them returned home on the evening of the 21st. Until 9:02 a.m. on the 22nd, surveillance video showed that four first responders knocked on Xiong's door with medical oxygen bags, first aid kits, stretchers and other equipment.

;

;9 minutes later, emergency personnel carried Hong Huanhuan out of Xiong's home. At this time, Xiong went out with the stretcher, then stood outside the door and looked into the house. There was also a man standing in the house. This man had not appeared in the video before, and neighbors and Hong Huanhuan's relatives said they did not recognize the man.

;

;The surveillance video 10 seconds later showed that the door of Xiong’s home was closed and all the emergency personnel were standing in the elevator. Xiong had an extra green coat on his left hand, and holding three plastic bags in his right hand, he also squeezed into the elevator from the corridor. A male voice asked: "She was a little confused before?" The female voice replied: "Yes, yes, yes."

;

;According to Hong Mingxuan, after being sent to the hospital on the 22nd , the housekeeping company received a call from Xiong, saying that Hong Huanhuan "fainted" at home. The housekeeping company immediately notified Hong Huanhuan's family and sent people to the hospital. Hong Mingxuan said that he was relatively close to the hospital at the time and was the first to arrive. The housekeeping company, Hong Huanhuan's parents, husband and other relatives and friends arrived one after another. "It turned out that my sister was no longer here."

;

;It was close to noon when Hong Mingxuan arrived. Hong Huanhuan had already received rescue measures in the hospital for about an hour and a half. "The employer insisted on sending her to the hospital for rescue." He did not provide Hong Huanhuan's death certificate to Southern Weekend reporters, which usually indicates the time of death. He explained that since the police have opened a case for investigation, the hospital has not issued a death certificate to the family members.

;

;Surveillance video shows that Xiong returned home at 10:58 and 13:30 on the day Hong Huanhuan was sent to the hospital. At 15:21 that day, several police officers came to Xiong’s home.

;

;Sister Wu Qiang rushed to the police station on the afternoon of the 22nd. She recalled that she saw Xiong at the police station, and the two of them pushed and pushed because of their excitement. In the end, she was pulled away by the police; there was a man next to her, "I heard that he was her (Xiong's) husband."

;

;Later, Hong Mingxuan learned from the housekeeping company that Xiong’s husband usually did business in Guangdong and returned to Wuhan the day before the incident; Xiong did not have a formal job in Wuhan , taking care of the baby at home every day. Hong Mingxuan said that except for the meeting with Xiong at the police station on the 22nd, he had never seen him again. "There was no explanation of the situation and no apology."

;

;On October 25, staff from the Houhu Police Station of the Jiangan District Branch of the Wuhan Municipal Public Security Bureau told the media that the police had filed a case and the suspect had been controlled. The details of the case The whole story is still under investigation. On November 7, staff from Houhu Police Station told Southern Weekend reporters that they would not comment on the case for the time being.

;

;I haven’t seen my family for five months

;

;Hong Huanhuan’s colleague Zhang Lijia said that the housekeeping company bought insurance for every aunt who came to the household. If an aunt encounters an accident when she comes to work, such as being injured or damaging the employer's property, she should inform the housekeeper and the insurance company within 24 hours, and the claim settlement process can be started. "Every aunt will undergo training in this area."

;

;Hong Huanhuan has been working as a housekeeping agent since 2018, and is familiar with how to deal with accidents when domestic workers come to the household. "I can't figure out why it was only a few days later that Bao's mother notified the company that something happened to her child," Zhang Lijia said.

;

;When they were agents, Hong Huanhuan and Zhang Lijia lived together in the attic of the office for more than a year. They often cook and sing together. In the summer after get off work, they would set up a table in front of the store to drink and have late-night snacks together. But after Hong Huanhuan moved into the household, the two of them had fewer opportunities to meet.

;

;On September 24, Zhang Lijia sent Hong Huanhuan a WeChat message and asked her what she was doing, but Hong Huanhuan did not reply. Zhang Lijia thought she was just busy. "When the crayfish came out (in summer), I asked her if she wanted to go out to eat together. She said that she probably didn't have time recently. Let's eat together when the hairy crabs come out (in autumn and winter)." When Zhang Lijia contacted Hong Huanhuan in the summer of 2023, the other party said this She agreed.

;

;Hong Huanhuan likes to shoot short videos, recording her daily life with family gatherings, going to the beach with colleagues, and taking her children out to play. These contents are updated frequently, and there are always several items a month. After transferring to a household, although the frequency has decreased, she still posted photos, recording some moments when she was infected with the new crown, New Year gatherings, and going for walks.

;

;On April 30, she and her daughter co-produced a short video of singing together, with the text: "The newly bought parent-child pajamas, this baby has to take a photo Video." Since then, this account has not posted any new content.

;

;That time coincided with Hong Huanhuan and Wu Qiang returning to Hanchuan. Their hometowns are both in the same town, about two kilometers apart. This was also the time when many relatives recalled the last time they saw Hong Huanhuan.

;

;Relatives in my hometown said that Hong Huanhuan looked fine on May Day. Wu Qiang's mother recalled that in the 15 years since their marriage, she had never seen her son and daughter-in-law have a word with each other. Even though she was sometimes short-tempered, Hong Huanhuan never had a dispute with her.

;

;;

;

;The entrance to Hong Huanhuan’s hometown village in Hanchuan, Hubei. Photo by Southern Weekend reporter Wang Xuqiulin

;

;Hong Huanhuan's colleague said that nanny's have four days of leave every month, and they can ask for leave from clients if they have something to do. Wu Qiang previously rented a room near his workplace in Wuhan, which was not close to Yintai Yuhuayuan, but Hong Huanhuan would go there every time he was on vacation. If they were free, the two would go back to their hometown to look after their children. Before every vacation to see Wu Qiang, Hong Huanhuan would go to Hong Mingxuan's house to see her parents.

;

;But after the May Day holiday in 2023, Hong Huanhuan did not take any vacation. When Hong Mingxuan saw that his sister had not been here for several months, he asked his mother about her current situation, "I always ask my mother to persuade my sister that there is endless money to be made, but every time we let her take a vacation, she always said that Bao's mother's children can't live without her. she".

;

;Hong Mingxuan did not return to Hanchuan on May Day and missed the opportunity to finally reunite with his sister. Looking back now, he regrets it.

;

;Hong Huanhuan has two mobile phones. When she was a housekeeping agent, she was basically online 24 hours a day. However, after becoming a housekeeping aunt, she often did not reply to messages in time. Gao Xuemei explained that it is considered a professional ethics for housekeeping aunts not to look at their mobile phones when taking care of the baby. Unless they check the time or encounter an emergency, they have to wait until the baby goes to bed at night before contacting the family.

;

;Hong Mingxuan said that after taking care of her two children, her family knew that Hong Huanhuan was busy with work and would not call on her if there was no urgent matter. My mother usually had a lot of contact with Hong Huanhuan, and she "would never go without replying to messages for a long time." However, after May Day, Hong Huanhuan rarely spoke in the family group, and sometimes it took several days to reply to messages. During one of these times, her mother had a I haven't contacted my daughter for many weeks and I am very anxious. They found Xiong through the housekeeping company and talked to Hong Huanhuan on the phone. They were told that "her mobile phone was broken."

;

;Hong Mingxuan said that he later learned from his sister’s friends that “the employer had confiscated her mobile phone.”

;

;Many relatives and friends said that Hong Huanhuan once said privately that he found this job "very tiring" and did not want to renew the contract. He would wait until Xiong found a suitable childcare nanny. household. But in September 2023, after one year, she signed a new contract with the other party. Gao Xuemei asked Hong Huanhuan why she renewed her contract, and Hong Huanhuan told her, "It's better to be experienced than to do it for a living. Once you are familiar with the customers and the baby, then just keep doing it."

;

;At this time, Hong Huanhuan and her children had not seen each other for nearly 5 months. After learning that Hong Huanhuan could not go home during the National Day holiday, her family made an appointment with her to meet her children downstairs in the community where she worked. But on October 1, Wu Qiang drove his two children from Hanchuan to Wuhan. When they were waiting for Hong Huanhuan to come out at the gate of Yintai Yuhuayuan, her mobile phone could not be contacted again.

;

;“No work at home”

;

;Gao Xuemei remembered that Hong Huanhuan said when they met a year ago: "Bao's mother (Xiong) is not easy. , she has to take care of her children and do things with me. She has also taught me a lot, and she is not willing to cause trouble to the agent. I will try my best to complete this list and complete this contract (period). ."

;

;The first time she went to the household, Hong Huanhuan’s usual requests for help were always related to Xiong’s children. In June and July 2023, she asked Gao Xuemei on WeChat: "Why is the baby's butt always red? Why does the baby always leak when wearing diapers?"

;

;Zhang Lijia said that she was not Hong Huanhuan's agent and could not comment on Hong Huanhuan's professional ability as a housekeeping aunt, but she believed that "aunties always have shortcomings" and "give her some patience and tolerance." , talents will grow slowly."

;

;In Gao Xuemei’s eyes, domestic work deals with people, and it is impossible not to be emotionally involved, “especially for children, if you don’t have love and patience, Can't do this."

;

;Zhang Lijia has always wanted to make the job of "domestic worker" more professional. She deliberately maintains some habits, such as showing her business card before communicating with clients, displaying posters showing herself in professional attire, and putting on makeup before going to work. There are also more than a dozen skills that housekeeping aunts can master after receiving training in the company. "Customers contribute to society outside the family, and we also provide customers with no worries at home."

;

;But she also admitted that the group of housekeeping aunts has average academic qualifications. It is not high and the economy is not well-off. Faced with the requirements of different customers, anxiety is normal.

;

;Before becoming a domestic agent, Zhang Lijia also worked as a live-in nanny. "Living at home is like a 24-hour service, without getting off work."

;

;After becoming an agent, Zhang Lijia needs to appease the housekeeping aunt when she comes to the house and needs help, such as Some aunts will report to her that they are accused by their employers of eating too much and cooking poorly... "Many times they cannot tell their families about their grievances."

;

; "It's too late to regret it." Another colleague who has a good relationship with Hong Huanhuan said that the housekeeping aunt is at the door 24 hours a day. She is worried that chatting with Hong Huanhuan will affect her work and rest, so she has not had any voice or video chat with Hong Huanhuan. "I didn't find any abnormalities earlier."

;

;Hong Huanhuan’s former office was hidden in a first-floor shop in a high-end community in Wuhan. This office of about 60 square meters has a kitchen, bathroom and dormitory. Zhang Lijia said that sometimes some aunts would come here to stay for two days when they were on vacation and could not go home far away.

;

;There are still shelves, small blackboards, green plants, medicines, and hooks purchased by Hong Huanhuan during his lifetime. After Hong Huanhuan came to the house, Zhang Lijia sat at her former workstation. "There are traces of Huanhuan everywhere."

;

;When dealing with Hong Huanhuan’s old things left in the store, Zhang Lijia left behind the microphone they used to sing together. She said that when they lived in the attic, one slept under a red mosquito net and the other slept under a white mosquito net. They called themselves the "Red Lotus Leader" and the "White Lotus Leader." "She is like my sister, who once brought so much joy to our lives."

;

;After Hong Huanhuan passed away, many housekeeping aunts expressed her social concern. Express your condolences under the account. Some aunts also sent messages to Zhang Lijia expressing concern. "Everyone misses her, and part of them thinks of themselves."
